name: Polar Rose #001
description: The polar rose is a famous mathematical curve that looks like a flower with petals. It can be defined by a simple equation in polar coordinates: for an arbitrary constant (including 0). If is an integer, then this equation will define a rose with petals for odd ones, or with petals for even ones. If is rational but not whole, the graph given by the equation forms a rose-like shape, but the petals will overlap. If - irrational, then the rose consists of an infinite number of partially overlapping petals.
